submapp.som.Som.distance_matrix¶

property Som.distance_matrix¶

Matrix of relative distance between each class

This matrix defines the “shape” of the SOM (eg. hexagonal, rectangular, etc.). E.g in the case of a euclidean distance between classes (rectangular map) the matrix is define as follows:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}distance[k_1, k_2] & = \sqrt{ (i_1-i_2)^2 + (j_1-j_2)^2 }\\k_1, k_2 & \in [|0, nb\_class-1 |]\\i_1, i_2 & \in [|0, n |]\\j_1, j_2 & \in [|0, m |]\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

Note:

(i, j) = location_classes[k]

Return type

np.ndarray[float], shape = (nb_class, nb_class)
